intro: Lamottea multifida, commonly known as the multifid lamottea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply lobed and often resemble the shape of a hand, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in warm, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
